text.p: Put images of tables and shit.
Expand grenades and stuff as I comb through the rules and other books.
Also gas grenade wind travel and stuff.
Add-ons for weapons to include 225m range grenade launcher.
Shotgun patterns
Actually read the rules so I can put in the correct stuff for equipment
Implemented

list.li: Weapons from CP3002.2 (except melee and old guns)

text.p: In most cases, encumbrance isn't a big problem for a Cyberpunk character—he's going to keep the majority of his gear in his apartment or his car. A Cyberpunk character can carry around as much in kilograms as the number of points invested in his Body Type stat, multiplied by 10. He can deadlift 40 times his Body Type stat.

Rather than list exact weights of everything you could possibly want to carry, we have arranged a simpler system of classification. The following weight groups are more useful to the Referee who must make a general determination of how much a player can carry.
The first thing your cyberpunk is gonna want is some weapons (weapons can get you out of a bad situation a lot faster than a great stereo). Cyberpunk weapons break into seven types:
- Pistols (P) are any type of single shot (or semiautomatic) weapon which may be accurately fired with one hand.
- Submachineguns (SMG) are any type of weapon which may fire either automatically or semi automatically, using only pistol ammunition.
- Shotguns (SHG) are any weapon which fires pellets or other small particles instead of a solid slug.
- Rifles (RIF) include assault rifles, carbines, and fully automatic rifles. These weapons always fire rifle type ammunition.
- Heavy Weapons (HVY) include missiles, grenades, heavy cannon, etc.
- Melee Weapons (MELEE) include swords, daggers, knives, martial arts weapons, polearms, etc.
- Exotic Weapons (EX); these are bows, lasers, flechette pistols, airguns and microwave weapons— the real "sci-fi" weapons of the Cyberpunk universe.

Each weapon is represented by certain characteristics, such as its type, damage, range, accuracy, concealability, availability and cost. These factors are recorded as a weapon code — a profile of the weapon in order of:
- Accuracy: This is how good the weapon really is. Weapons are rated from -3 to +3 on accuracy, with 0 being an average level of accuracy.

- Concealability: How easily they can be hidden until needed (an important factor in combat weapons). A smart combat gunner doesn't want to walk into a bar with a shotgun protruding from underneath his coat—it's going to cause trouble. He also needs to be able to carry "holdouts" in the event of capture or disarmament.
- Availability: This is how difficult the weapon is to find on the open market.

list.li: (E) = Excellent: Can be found almost anywhere.
(C) = Common: Can be found in most sports & gun stores or on the Street.
(P) = Poor: Specialty weapons, black market, stolen military.
(R) = Rare: Stolen, one of a kind, special military issue, may be highly illegal.

text.p: - Damage/Ammunition: Each weapon is rated as to the type of ammunition it carries, and the damage of that ammunition (in numbers of dice thrown).
- Number of Shots: This is how many shots are held in the standard clip, magazine or quiver for the weapon type.
- Rate of Fire: This is how many shots the weapon can fire in a single combat round (3.2 seconds).
- Reliability: This is how reliable the weapon is in combat—its chance of jamming while on autofire, etc.

Find your Role, cross reference it to your current Special Ability Level, and that'll give you a monthly salary. Multiply this amount bya 1d6/3 to determine the number of months you've currently been employed, and that gives you the total amount of cash you start with.
* Half effect is Drowsiness, -2 to all STATS

description.p: It's cheap. It's powerful. It blows up sometimes. What else do you want?
Rugged, reliable, with excellent stopping power. Another fine E.C.C. product from the United Germanies.
Designed as an alternate to the 1998 U.S. Army sidearm trials. A solid contender.

id-00003.name: Armalite 44
id-00003.nonidentified: The only thing unwieldy in your pocket.

description.p: Now the standard officer's sidearm for the U.S. Army, the M-2000 served well in the Central American Wars.

id-00006.name: Colt AMD Model 2000
id-00006.nonidentified: The only thing unwieldy in your pocket.

description.p: Mines can have the same variants as grenades. The damage here is for a fragmentation mine.

id-00004.name: Generic Mine
id-00004.nonidentified: "NOT A STEP" is printed on one side.

description.p: The cyberpsycho hunter's favorite. Almost 2 meters long, this “cannon" fires a depleted uranium shell at supersonic speeds. Heavy AP sub-caliber penetrator damages armor 2pts/hit.
The third generation of the Stinger missile launcher, this shoulder arm fires one missile.
Shoulder-mounted, rocket-powered grenade launcher. Heavily used in the Central American conflicts under the name RPG-A.

id-00029.name: Militech Arms RPG-A
id-00029.nonidentified: Don't try to rocket jump with this.

description.p: Range = BODY x 10 in meters.

id-00030.name: Generic Fragmentation Grenade

Costs 100 per kg.
Damage is per kg.
Can also be bought as an under barrel attachment for your favorite assault rifle. Now in 24 new, trendy colors.

description.p: A light duty autopistol used as a holdout and "lady's gun".
Cheap Hong Kong knockoff, often used by boosters and other street trash.
The ubiquitous "Polymer-one-shot" cheap plastic pistol. Available in designer colors.
A well-made autopistol with good range and accuracy. A professional's gun.
Another Dai Lung cheapie, built for the Street.
A sturdy Solo's gun, used as a standard military sidearm in the U.S. and E.C.C.
Uzi's entry into the 21st century, all plastic, with a rotary electric clip and adjustable trigger. The choice for many security Solos.
Heckler & Koch's updating of the MP-5K classic, with compound plastics and built in silencing.
An updated version of the venerable Tech Assault I, features larger clip, better autofire, no melting. Honest.
The standard Arasaka Security weapon, found worldwide. A good, all round weapon.
A light composite submachinegun with integral sights. Used by many Euro Solos.
Sternmeyer's best entry in the anti-terrorist category, with wide use on C-SWAT teams and PsychoSquads.

Possibly the most used Solo's gun in existence, the MPK-1 1 can be modified into four different designs, including a bullpup configuration, standard SMG, an assault carbine, and a grenade launcher mount.
Updated MAC-10, with composite body and cylindrical feeding magazine.
A light, all purpose update, similar to the M-16B.
A plastic and carbon fiber update of the AKM, distributed throughout the remains of the Soviet Bloc.
The standard NATO assault weapon for battlefield work. Bullpup design, collapsing stock.
Another Soviet retread, with improved sighting and lightened with composites.
A high powered auto-shotgun with lethal firepower. Used by Arasaka worldwide. Another good reason to avoid the Boys in Black.
Light duty stakeout shotgun, used by city police departments.
Flashlight sized microwave projector. See FNFF, pg. 108 for details.

id-00040.name: Techtronica 15 Microwaver
id-00040.nonid_name: Flashlight with Handgun Grip and Trigger
id-00040.nonidentified: Looks like it takes one of those heavy duty 6V batteries.

description.p: Plastic and bimetal crossbow. Silent, deadly, and you usually getyour ammo back.
Gyrobalanced, stabilized compound bow. Silent & deadly.
Zap. About the size of a small hand flashlight. See CP3002.2 pg.107 for details.
Forces a Stun Save with an additonal -2 for every successive shot within a 3 second period. Takes an hour to recharge.

id-00049.name: Miltech Electronics Taser
id-00049.nonidentified: Someone scratched "DONT TAZE ME BRO" on the side.

linklist.link: Paintball gun from hell. Can fire acid, paint, drugs, poison. See CP3002.2 pg 107 for more.
A squirtgun. Yes, a powered squirtgun. See CP3002.2 pg. 108 before you laugh.

description.p: Each shot counts as 2 pellets/doses.
Lightweight, plastic, compressed air powered. Can be doped with drugs, poison. Check CP3002.2 pg 107 for more.
Milspec laser cannon, rarely seen.

Lasers have a rechargeable powerpack holding a total of 10d6 dice of damage. You may use as little as 1d6 or as much as 5d6 in a single shot, untill you have used all 10 dice. Lasers recharge from wall current at a rate of 1d6 per hour.

id-00053.name: Militech Electronics Laser Cannon
id-00053.nonidentified: Do not use as a flashlight.

id-00001.result: Something has happened to one or both parents
Your family is imprisoned and you alone escaped
Your family was exiled or otherwise driven from their original home/nation/corporation
Your family lost everything through bad management
Your family is involved in a longterm conspiracy, organization, or association; such as a crime family or revolutionary group
Your family was murdered/killed and you were the only survivor
Your family vanished. You are the only remaining member
You are the inheritor of a family debt; you must honor this debt before moving on with your life
Your family is cursed with a hereditary feud that has lasted for generations
Your family was scattered to the winds due to misfortune
Your family lost everything through betrayal

Your parents died in an accident
You were left with relatives for safekeeping
Your parents are in hiding to protect you
Your parents sold you for money
Your parents gave you up for adoption
You grew up on the Street and never had parents
Family status is okay, even if parents are missing or dead
Family status is in danger, and you risk losing everything (if you haven't already)
Your Childhood was spent in a decaying, once upscale neighborhood
Your Childhood was spend in a Nomad Pack moving from town to town
Your Childhood was spent in a safe Corporate Suburbia
Your Childhood was spent on the Street, with no adult supervision
Your Childhood was spent in a small village or town far from the City
Your Childhood was spent in the heart of the Combat Zone
Your Childhood was spent in a defended Corporate Zone in the central City
Your Childhood was spent on a corporate controlled Farm or Research Facility
Your Childhood was spent in an aquatic Pirate Pack
Your Childhood was spent in a large arcology city

id-00021.labelcol1: How Do [you] Feel About Most People
id-00021.name: x Attitude to Others

id-00001.result: People are tools. Use them for your own goal and discard them
Every person is a valuable individual
Wipe 'em all out and give the place to the cockroaches
People are untrustworthy. Don't depend on anyone
People are obstacles to be destroyed if they cross you
Betrayal: You have been backstabbed in some manner.
Illness or Addiction: You have contracted either an illness or drug habit in this time. Lose 1 pt of REF permanently as a result.
Imprisonment: You have been in prison or possibly held hostage (your choice). Roll 1d10 for the length of your imprisonment in month.
Financial Loss or Debt: Roll 1d10x100. You have lost this much in Eurodollars. If you can't pay this now, you have a debt to pay, in cash -- or blood.
False Accusation: You were set up.
Lover, Friend, or Relative is Killed: You lost someone you really cared about.
Accident: You were in some kind of terrible accident.
Mental or Physical Incapacitation: You have experienced some type of mental or physical breakdown.
Hunted by a Corporation: You have angered some corporate honcho.
Hunted by the Law: You are hunted by the law for crimes you may or may not have committed (your choice).
Find a Sensei: Begin at +2 or add +1 to a Martial Arts Skill of your choice.
Big Score on a Job or Deal: Roll 1d10x100 for amount in Eurodollars gained.
Financial Windfall: Roll 1d10x100 for amount in Eurodollars gained.
Local Nomad Pack Befriends You: You can call on them for one favor a month. Equivalent to Family +2.
Powerful Corporate Executive owes you one favor.
Find a Teacher: Begin at +2 or add +1 to an INT-based skill of your choice.
Find a Combat Teacher: Begin at +2 or add +1 to any Weapon skill except Martial Arts or Brawling.
Local Boostergang Likes You (who knows why. These are boosters, right?): You can call on them for one favor a month. Equivalent to Family +2, but don't push your luck.
Make a Friend on the Police Force: You can get insider information on any police related situation. Equivalent to Streetwise +2.

id-00033.name: x What are You Gonna Do About It?

id-00001.result: Live it down and try to forget it.
Save, if possible, anyone else involved in the situation.
Hunt down those responsible and MAKE THEM PAY!
You were betrayed by a close friend in either romance or career (your choice).
You lost 1d10 months of your memory that year.
You were hospitalized for 1d10 months that year.
You were terribly disfigured and must subtract -5 from your ATT.
You constantly relive nightmares of the accident and wake up screaming (80% chance of happening each night).

id-00037.name: x Lover, Friend, or Relative Killed

id-00001.result: They were murdered by unknown parties.
They were murdered and you know who did it. You just need the proof.
You were accused of being a coward.
You were accused of lying or betrayal.
You are being hunted by an entire Local Police Force.
You are being hunted by a couple of local cops.
You are being hunted by the FBI or equivalent National Police Force.
You are being hunted by the State Police or Militia.
You are being hunted by a larger corp with offices statewide.
You are being hunted by a small, local firm.
You are being hunted by a huge, multinational with armies, ninja, and spies EVERYWHERE.
You are being hunted by a big, national corp with agents in major cities nationwide.
It's some kind of mental problem; you suffer anxiety attacks and phobias -- subtract -1 from CL.
It's some type of nervous disorder, probably from a bioplague -- subtract -1 from REF.
It's a major psychosis. You hear voices, are violent, irrational, depressive. Subtract -1 from both REF and CL.
Your friend is from a common interest
Your friend is a a teacher or mentor
Your friend is a partner or co-worker
Your friend is an old lover
Your friend is an old enemy
Your friend is like a foster parent to you
Your friend is an old childhood friend
Your friend is like a big brother/sister to you
Your friend is like a kid brother/sister to you
This started when one of you caused the other to loase face or status
This started when one of you caused the loss of a lover, friend, or relative
This started when one of you foiled a plan of the other's
This started when one of you deserted or betrayed the other
This started when one of you caused a physical disability.
This started when one of you accused the other of cowardice or some other personal flaw
This started when one of you caused a major humiliation
This started when one of you turned down the other's offer of job or romantic involvement
This started because you just didn't like each other
This started when one of you was a romantic rival.

id-00051.name: x Whatcha' Gonna Do About It?

id-00001.result: If the two of you met face to face, the injured party would most likely go into a murderous, killing rage and rip the other's face off!
If the two of you met face to face, the injured party would most likely rip into the other verbally
If the two of you met face to face, the injured party would most likely avoid the scum
If the two of you met face to face, the injured party would most likely ignore the scum
If the two of you met face to face, the injured party would most likely backstab the other indirectly

id-00052.name: x What Your Enemy Throw Against You?

id-00001.result: A personal goal or vendetta came between you two
Lover was killed in a fight
Rival cut you out of the action
You have conflicted backgrounds and families
One of you was insanely jealous
You were seperated in some way
One of you had a romantic rival
Your lover's friends/family would use you

id-00063.name: x EMP Fumble chance of violence

id-00001.result: Oh they also want to do you physical harm

id-00010.description: On a natural roll of 10, you have had a critical success. Roll an additional 1d10 and add it to your original roll. Then Re-roll the die one more time, if you roll a 9 or 10 you have critically succeeded.
id-00010.name: [CRITICAL] Critical Hit

id-00001.result: Weapon does Maximum Damage as if from point blank
You may choose the hit location (Head, Arm, etc). If this is a called shot, you may choose a specific location (Eye, finger, groin, etc)
Weapon hits a weak spot in opponent's armor; armor is treated as 1/4
Weapon his 2 Targets (via richochet, over penetration, etc); second target takes half damage
Weapon knocks opponent off their feet
Weapon hits something explosive or flammable (exposives, ammo, fuel, etc) on opponent or target, and detonate or ignites. (If applicable)
Impact from your weapon automatically disarms opponent
Blood, shrapnel, or another substance released from your weapon's damage gets into your target's eyes, blinding them for 1 Round
Weapons shocks enemy more than normal, Stun Save at -2
No fumble, you just screw up.
Weapon Jams (make Reliability Roll) or imbeds itself in the ground for one turn. (Monoblades or Slice & Dice automatically break.)
You manage to wound yourself. Roll for location.
You manage to wound a member of your own party.
Weapon discharges or strikes something harmlessly.
No fumble. You just mess up and make an idiot of yourself.
You fail abysmally. If a physical action, take 1d6 in damage from falling or strained muscles. Also make a Save vs Stun -1.
You fail miserably. Take 1 point of minor damage (sprain, fall, stumble), plus make a Save vs Stun.
Wow, did you ever blow it! You damage the device or creation beyond repair. Buy a new one.
You not only fail, you make it worse! You drop the tools you're working with, or lose your grip and damage the thing you're working with even more. Raise the Difficulty by 5 points and try again.
No fumble. You just can't get it together.

id-00045.name: [CRITICAL] EMP Fumble - Convince, Fast Talk, Seduce

id-00001.result: No fumble, they just won't buy it.
So much for your people skills. You not only don't convince them, you leave them totally cold to any other suggestion you might have. (-4 to your next EMP roll.)
You! You blew it royally. You not only didn't convince them, but now they're actually violently opposed to anything you want to do.

id-00046.name: [CRITICAL] INT Fumble - Figure Out, Notice, Catch a Clue

id-00001.result: You don't know anything about what is going on, and you haven't a clue about how to do anything about it. Make a Convince check at -2 to see if anyone else notices how dumb you are.
Wow, are you oblivious. You not only don't know what's going on or anything about the subject, but everyone know how ignorant you are.
No fumble. You just don't know how to do it. You don't know what's going on. You carry on, oblivious to higher converns.

id-00054.description: Roll 1d10. Jammed weapons take 1d6 turns to unjam with a Weaponsmith 10 Difficulty roll.
id-00054.name: [CRITICAL] Reliability Roll

id-00002.result: 1d6 Turns to unjam with Weaponsmith 10 Difficulty roll
1d6 Turns to unjam with two Weaponsmith 15 Difficulty rolls
1d6 Turns to unjam with two Weaponsmith 20 Difficulty rolls, a roll of 1 destroys the weapon

Neural pulse! If character has interface plugs, reflex boosts, or other hardwiring, REF stat reduced by 1d6/2 until repaired.
Cyberlimb malfunctions. Lose all use of cyberlimb for 1d10 turns.
Total Neural breakdown! Character reduced to a twitching, epileptic fit for 1d6/3 turns.
